trans-unit.source: Getting started with cmdlets in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Getting started with cmdlets in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: Suspend and restart SQL Data Warehouse using PowerShell cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Suspend and restart SQL Data Warehouse using PowerShell cmdlets

trans-unit.source: Getting started with Azure Data Warehouse cmdlets and REST APIs
trans-unit.target: Getting started with Azure Data Warehouse cmdlets and REST APIs

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse can be managed using either Azure PowerShell cmdlets or REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse can be managed using either Azure PowerShell cmdlets or REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: The commands defined for Azure SQL Database are also used for SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: The commands defined for Azure SQL Database are also used for SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: For a current list, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a current list, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlets Suspend-AzureSqlDatabase and Resume-AzureSqlDatabase (below) are additions designed for SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlets Suspend-AzureSqlDatabase and Resume-AzureSqlDatabase (below) are additions designed for SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, the REST APIs for SQL Azure Database can also be used for SQL Data Warehouse instances.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, the REST APIs for SQL Azure Database can also be used for SQL Data Warehouse instances.

trans-unit.source: For the current list, see <link><linkText>Operations for Azure SQL Databases</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For the current list, see <link><linkText>Operations for Azure SQL Databases</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Get and run the Azure PowerShell cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Get and run the Azure PowerShell cmdlets

trans-unit.source: To download the Azure PowerShell module, run <link><linkText>Microsoft Web Platform Installer</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To download the Azure PowerShell module, run <link><linkText>Microsoft Web Platform Installer</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To run the module, at the start window type Microsoft Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: To run the module, at the start window type Microsoft Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already added your account to the machine, run the following cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already added your account to the machine, run the following cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: (For more information, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>:
trans-unit.target: (For more information, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>:

trans-unit.source: Switch the mode with this cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Switch the mode with this cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: Suspend-AzureSqlDatabase
trans-unit.target: Suspend-AzureSqlDatabase

trans-unit.source: Example 1: Pause a database by name on a server
trans-unit.target: Example 1: Pause a database by name on a server

trans-unit.source: This example pauses a database named "Database02" hosted on a server named "Server01."
trans-unit.target: This example pauses a database named "Database02" hosted on a server named "Server01."

trans-unit.source: The server is in an Azure resource group named "ResourceGroup1."
trans-unit.target: The server is in an Azure resource group named "ResourceGroup1."

trans-unit.source: Example 2: Pause a database object
trans-unit.target: Example 2: Pause a database object

trans-unit.source: This example retrieves a database named "Database02" from a server named "Server01" contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."
trans-unit.target: This example retrieves a database named "Database02" from a server named "Server01" contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."

trans-unit.source: It pipes the retrieved object to Suspend-AzureSqlDatabase.
trans-unit.target: It pipes the retrieved object to Suspend-AzureSqlDatabase.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the database is paused.
trans-unit.target: As a result, the database is paused.

trans-unit.source: Resume-AzureSqlDatabase
trans-unit.target: Resume-AzureSqlDatabase

trans-unit.source: Example 1: Resuming a database by name on a server
trans-unit.target: Example 1: Resuming a database by name on a server

trans-unit.source: This example resumes operation of a database named "Database02" hosted on a server named "Server01."
trans-unit.target: This example resumes operation of a database named "Database02" hosted on a server named "Server01."

trans-unit.source: The server is contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."
trans-unit.target: The server is contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."

trans-unit.source: Example 2: Resuming a database object
trans-unit.target: Example 2: Resuming a database object

trans-unit.source: This example retrieves a database named "Database02" from a server named "Server01" that is contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."
trans-unit.target: This example retrieves a database named "Database02" from a server named "Server01" that is contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."

trans-unit.source: The object is piped to Resume-AzureSqlDatabase.
trans-unit.target: The object is piped to Resume-AzureSqlDatabase.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureSqlDatabaseRestorePoints
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureSqlDatabaseRestorePoints

trans-unit.source: This cmdlet lists the backup restore points for an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: This cmdlet lists the backup restore points for an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: The restore points are used to restore the database.
trans-unit.target: The restore points are used to restore the database.

trans-unit.source: The properties for the returned object are as follows.
trans-unit.target: The properties for the returned object are as follows.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: RestorePointType
trans-unit.target: RestorePointType

trans-unit.source: DISCRETE / CONTINUOUS.
trans-unit.target: DISCRETE / CONTINUOUS.

trans-unit.source: Discrete restore points describe the possible point-in-times that an Azure SQL database can be restored to.
trans-unit.target: Discrete restore points describe the possible point-in-times that an Azure SQL database can be restored to.

trans-unit.source: Continuous restore points describe the earliest possible point-in-times that an Azure SQL database can be restored to.
trans-unit.target: Continuous restore points describe the earliest possible point-in-times that an Azure SQL database can be restored to.

trans-unit.source: The database can be restored to any point-in-time after the earliest point.
trans-unit.target: The database can be restored to any point-in-time after the earliest point.

trans-unit.source: EarliestRestoreDate
trans-unit.target: EarliestRestoreDate

trans-unit.source: Earliest Restore Time (Populated when restorePointType = CONTINUOUS)
trans-unit.target: Earliest Restore Time (Populated when restorePointType = CONTINUOUS)

trans-unit.source: RestorePointCreationDate
trans-unit.target: RestorePointCreationDate

trans-unit.source: Backup Snapshot Time (Populated when restorePointType = DISCRETE)
trans-unit.target: Backup Snapshot Time (Populated when restorePointType = DISCRETE)

trans-unit.source: Example 1: Retrieving a database’s restore points by name on a server
trans-unit.target: Example 1: Retrieving a database’s restore points by name on a server

trans-unit.source: This example retrieves the restore points for a database named "Database02" from a server named "Server01," contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."
trans-unit.target: This example retrieves the restore points for a database named "Database02" from a server named "Server01," contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."

trans-unit.source: Example 2: Resuming a database object
trans-unit.target: Example 2: Resuming a database object

trans-unit.source: This example retrieves a database named "Database02" from a server named "Server01," contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."
trans-unit.target: This example retrieves a database named "Database02" from a server named "Server01," contained in a resource group named "ResourceGroup1."

trans-unit.source: The database object is piped to Get-AzureSqlDatabase, and the result is the database’s restore points.
trans-unit.target: The database object is piped to Get-AzureSqlDatabase, and the result is the database’s restore points.

trans-unit.source: Note that if your server is foo.database.windows.net, use "foo" as the -ServerName in the powershell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: Note that if your server is foo.database.windows.net, use "foo" as the -ServerName in the powershell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For more reference information, see <link><linkText>SQL Data Warehouse reference overview[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more reference information, see <link><linkText>SQL Data Warehouse reference overview[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
